title: Build fails on Android due to missing libfftw3.a library for x86_64 architecture
body:
## Description
When trying to build an Android app that uses react-native-audio-api, the build fails due to a missing FFTW3 library file for the x86_64 architecture.

### Environment
- react-native-audio-api: ^0.4.2
- React Native: 0.76.6
- Android Gradle Plugin: 8.6.0
- Gradle: 8.10.2
- Expo: ~52.0.30

### Error Message
C/C++: ninja: error: '../../../../libs/x86_64/libfftw3.a', needed by '../../../../build/intermediates/cxx/Debug/5q4p5b6z/obj/x86_64/libreact-native-audio-api.so', missing and no known rule to make it

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install react-native-audio-api in a React Native project
2. Try to build for Android with x86_64 architecture support

### Expected Behavior
The project should build successfully with x86_64 architecture support.

### Actual Behavior
Build fails due to missing libfftw3.a library for x86_64 architecture.

### Additional Context
The error suggests that the FFTW3 library binary for x86_64 architecture is missing from the project's libs directory. This might be an issue with the package distribution or architecture support.
author: jaabiri

comments.body: I have added support for `x86-64` in latest release 0.4.3 ;))

@maciejmakowski2003 It seems the issue happens for x86 now.. ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ 


```
> com.android.ide.common.process.ProcessException: ninja: Entering directory `/home/expo/workingdir/build/node_modules/react-native-audio-api/android/.cxx/Debug/b681yl3b/x86'
  [0/2] Re-checking globbed directories...
  C++ build system [build] failed while executing:
      /home/expo/Android/Sdk/cmake/3.22.1/bin/ninja \
        -C \
        /home/expo/workingdir/build/node_modules/react-native-audio-api/android/.cxx/Debug/b681yl3b/x86 \
        react-native-audio-api
    from /home/expo/workingdir/build/node_modules/react-native-audio-api/android
  ninja: error: '../../../../libs/x86/libfftw3.a', needed by '../../../../build/intermediates/cxx/Debug/b681yl3b/obj/x86/libreact-native-audio-api.so', missing and no known rule to make it
```
@maciejmakowski2003 Awesome, thank you! Can confirm: the build finished successfully!

title: decodeAudioDataSource is not defined
body:
Thank you for the great library.
I tried to run the AudioFile example on my project. However, I found no `decodeAudioDataSource` function in `0.2.0`.
When would it be included?
author: sgwanlee

comments.body:
Hey, thank you! :) 

Unfortunatelly `decodeAudioDataSource` is not yet available in `0.2.0`

It should be available in `0.3.0-rc1` which is available through `npm install react-native-audio-api@next`. But so far the implementation only supports iOS and web.

Once we will have android implemented and well-tested, we'll realease the full `0.3.0`.

It should be a matter of couple of days, I will ping you here once ready :)
Thank you for letting me know!
We have just released react-native-aduio-api `0.3.1`, which fully implements those functionality, so I am closing this issue :))

title: [Example] Drum machine crashes after two loops
body:
- fill in all hihats
- add kick at 1 & 3*
- add clap at 2 & 4*

After two loops the sound starts to glitch out and then disappears completely

*with counting the buttons as `1, &, 2, &, 3, &, 4, &` :)
author: michalsek

comments.body:
`AddInstanceForFactory: No factory registered for id <CFUUID 0x600000317180> F8BB1C28-BAE8-11D6-9C31-00039315CD46

title: feat: nodes properties implementation
body:
- Implement getters for `numberOfInputs`, `numberOfOutputs`, and `context` in AudioNode
- Implement getters for `minValue`, `maxValue` and `defaultValue` in AudioParam
- Implement `state`, `sampleRate` and `currentTime` in AudioContext

title: Feat/android/oscillator node
body:
-Implemented oscillator class in Kotlin containing whole sound generating logic and AudioContex native module which provides method for creating oscillator instance on JS side( `createOscillator( )`)
-Implemented c++ HybridClass for this oscillator
-Implemented jsi HostObject for this oscillator and injected it into js runtime
-Integrate it with AudioContext class having HybridClass na HostObject

Closes: #16 
Closes: #21
author: maciejmakowski2003
